intro: Sarcocephalus richardii, commonly known as the African mountain gum, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems, though it is not widely cultivated.
